instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Hi guys, happy new year! I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight (can see the apple logo with flashlight). The board seems not to have liquid damage looks very clean also the area round <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and LCD Connector. I get 12.61v on pin 9/10. I did notice I have no voltage on the backlight Enable pin 17, what should this be? <RESISTOR>R7742</RESISTOR> = 0 ohm. Any suggestions?

EDIT: Some extra messure i did:

<CAPACITOR>C7717</CAPACITOR> pin 1 = 5.17v
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 = 12.51v
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> pin 4 = 12.61v
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1/2/3/4 = 0v
<RESISTOR>R7701</RESISTOR> = 80.3k ohm
<RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR> = 63.5k ohm

So i figure the enable signal is not working for the backlight, please correct me if im wrong in my assumption

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: No idea what this is. Is it a 3437 or a 3476? Pin 9/10 of what, where?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: This is a typo in the title its a retina 13 inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, I cannot change the title anymore sorry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: If there is no liquid damage first try a known good LCD. If that works it may be a bad LCD cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Yes tried with 2 working LCD both no backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Yes one of them belongs to this Mac board and works with another working board (3437 as well). <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.43

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Oh now it is a 3437 again?
PRAM reset? What is the voltage on the backlight pin on LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Sorry its so hectic here my brain sometimes struggles with all data .... it is still a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Retina last time i checked :).

Voltage on LCD Backlight Pin is 0, checked continuity between <CAPACITOR>C7717</CAPACITOR> to pin 1 = ok and no short to ground (reads 0.761v on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>). I think I have tried PRAM already but i can try again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Diode mode on pins 3 and 4 of LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: At this point I would swap the backlight IC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: OK will try that let you know the result
